title: Best laptops under Rs 60,000
meta_description: Top laptops under ₹60,000: i9 power, RTX visuals, all-day battery, Mac efficiency, find your perfect budget performer.

h2: Under ₹60,000, choose between Intel H-series Core i7 powerhouses or RTX 3050-equipped rigs for smooth gaming and creative tasks.
With 16 GB RAM, PCIe 4.0 SSDs, crisp 15.6-inch Full HD IPS panels, these laptops handle multitasking, rendering and playback effortlessly.
Battery packs up to ~70 Wh and fast USB-C charging deliver all-day productivity without hunting for outlets.
From sub-1.3 kg fanless MacBook Air to 2 kg RTX-equipped workhorses, there’s a model for every portability-power balance.
This guide breaks down CPU, GPU, display and battery specs, helping you pick the perfect under-₹60,000 laptop for your needs.
Lenovo IdeaPad Slim 3 – ₹62,990
MSI Thin A15 – ₹59,990
MacBook Air M1 – ₹59,990
ASUS’s Vivobook 16X – ₹59,990
Acer’s Swift Go 14 – ₹54,990
Infinix’s ZeroBook 13 – ₹58,990
Colourful XS 15 – ₹51,990
Which laptop should you buy?

paragraphs: When you have ₹60,000 to spend on a laptop, let me assure you that you have a good budget and you can either get a laptop with a discrete GPU or a CPU that can handle all the basic + some creative tasks like rendering, compilations, etc., efficiently. To do justice to your budget, we have handpicked

Lenovo’s IdeaPad Slim 3 brings desktop-class punch to a thin-and-light 1.7 kg chassis by pairing Intel’s 13th-Gen Core i7-13620H (10-cores, 16-threads, turbo to 4.9 GHz) with 16 GB LPDDR5-4800 memory and a 512 GB PCIe SSD. The 15.6-inch Full-HD IPS panel delivers 300 nits brightness, an anti-glare c

Who should buy this laptop: Power users who crunch large spreadsheets, edit photos, or code in multiple IDEs will welcome the H-series CPU and 16 GB RAM. Commuters who want a full-size screen without lugging more than 1.7 kg get solid battery life, USB-C charging, and a privacy webcam. Small-busines

MSI’s Thin A15 packs desktop-style horsepower into a 1.86 kg, 21.7 mm chassis: AMD’s Ryzen 5 7535HS delivers 6 Zen 3 Plus cores and 12 threads that turbo to 4.55 GHz for fast compile times and smooth 1080p gaming, while NVIDIA’s GeForce RTX 3050 (4 GB GDDR6) pairs with a 144 Hz, 15.6 in IPS-level di
Also read: Best laptops for design and animation students

paragraphs: When you’re on the lookout for a laptop under  ₹60,000 in September 2025, it's about finding something that works for both the long hours of work and those rare moments of downtime. With so many options out there, it can feel like a challenge to choose the right one. You need a machine that delivers
We've put together a list of the top 8 laptops that tick all the boxes, so you can pick with confidence, knowing you’re getting value and reliability in one package.

The Dell New 15 laptop strikes the perfect balance between power and portability. Equipped with 16GB DDR4 RAM and a 512GB SSD, it ensures smooth multitasking and fast data access, making it ideal for both work and entertainment.
With Windows 11 and Office H&S 2024 pre installed, it offers great value, making it an excellent option for those looking to stay productive while keeping their budget in check.

mainEntity.name: Are gaming laptops available under ₹60,000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, there are options like the MSI Modern 15 that handle light gaming well under  ₹60,000.

mainEntity.name: What display quality should I expect from laptops under ₹60,000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Laptops in this range typically feature FHD or FHD+ displays, ensuring sharp and vibrant visuals.

mainEntity.name: Can I use a laptop under ₹60,000 for video editing?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, some models like the Acer Aspire offer decent performance for light video editing, though they may struggle with heavy editing tasks.

mainEntity.name: Is 16GB RAM enough for multitasking on laptops under ₹60,000?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, 16GB RAM provides excellent multitasking capabilities and handles everyday tasks smoothly.

mainEntity.name: Are laptops under ₹60,000 good for business use?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, laptops like the ASUS Vivobook S16 offer great performance and productivity tools like Office 2024, ideal for business use.
